intro: Solenandra rotundata, commonly known as the golden torch ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features striking, orange-red bracts that surround its small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Solenandra rotundata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
